comment.body:
> [daemonite](#comment_1_17APnPRcGuuvH8DGtRRNQ7aTFrzVJDWAjq): how to make zeronet start on boot?

Just make a systemd unit, an RC script, or something. I have `/Programs/elf/ZeroBundle/ZeroNet.sh &` in my X.Org session startup script.
@daemonite are you installing from Internet or from a local mirror?

> [daemonite](#comment_3_17APnPRcGuuvH8DGtRRNQ7aTFrzVJDWAjq): netinstall iso(debian-8.11.1-i386-netinst.iso)

Is the machine connected to Internet via plain Ethernet cable, or something more complicated like Wi-FI or modems? Debian is very puritanish when it comes to the freedom, so a lot of hardware that needs proprietary firmware won't work out of box. Did you install it successfully on the same machine before?
